definition: as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly

sentences.english: Beaufort had entered the little house with his usual easy assurance.
sentences.chinese: 鲍富特象平时一样厚着脸皮若无其事地走进那小屋。

sentences.english: She raised her head and nonchalantly extended her hand, the palm up.
sentences.chinese: 她抬起头，若无其事的摊开手掌，掌心向上。

sentences.english: Individual will of people is put fluky , as if nothing happened or adopt precautionary measures.
sentences.chinese: 个别人心存侥幸，若无其事或采取预防措施。

sentences.english: I asked, as casually as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我问道，尽量装得若无其事。

sentences.english: Even if that is heard softly sigh, surface if nothing had happened, incomparable inner struggle.
sentences.chinese: 即使那轻轻的一声叹，表面若无其事，内心无比挣扎。

sentences.english: I can pop a top on a cold one and watch TV.
sentences.chinese: 我能从狂热中迅速冷静下来，若无其事地观看电视。

sentences.english: When Baylor full court, people looked at the ceiling with equanimity .
sentences.chinese: 当贝勒满法庭上的人若无其事地望着天花板。

sentences.english: Giles phoned this morning, " Mirella said with feigned indifference."
sentences.chinese: “贾尔斯今早来电话了，”米雷拉装作若无其事地说。

sentences.english: He walked into the shop and calmly (ie impudently and self-confidently) stole a pair of gloves.
sentences.chinese: 他走进商店若无其事地偷了一副手套。

sentences.english: I walked the cellar from end to end calmly.
sentences.chinese: 我若无其事地从地窖这头走到那头。

sentences.english: It was Passepartout who, playing his part with a happy audacity, had passed through the crowd amid the general terror.
sentences.chinese: 正是他，若无其事地走过那一片被吓昏了的人群。

sentences.english: In spite of his resolutions, he could not hide altogether that something had happened.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他这样打定主意，但他仍然不能装得若无其事。

definition: not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
not a word or movement (idiom); remaining calm and collected/not batting an eyelid
to pretend/to feign/to act a part
cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
calm and unhurried (idiom); composed/to take matters calmly
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
to be calm and unruffled in the midst of chaos or at a busy time (idiom)
to not mind (at all, a bit)/to not care in the slightest
